page.title: 17Thorngrove House.
page.content: Thorngrove is a beautiful house in spacious grounds on the outskirts of Gillingham.It has survived two wars and several changes of use.We first meet the house in the 1900's as the lovely home of Sir Harold Pelly, 5th Baronet and Lady Pelly. During the second world war the house was used to billet American soldiers.Many of these have since returned to visit the house and the many friends they made in the area. After the war the property was bought on behalf of Dr.Barnardos and was run as a Children's Home. The interior decoration was changed to the sombre colours used in institutions at that time.Some twelve years later the children were transferred to the Barnardos Home in Horsington and Thorngrove House was once again for sale.
